question: Question_08_(c)
statement:
The growth rate of a plant during the first week after germination is
given by

\[\displaystyle g(t) = ae^{t/2} \text{ mm/day},\]

where the time \emph{t} is measured in days, and \emph{a} is a constant.

How much did the plant grow on the fifth day (i.e. between \emph{t = 4}
and \emph{t = 5})? (If you don't know the constant \emph{a}, use \emph{a
= 1}.)
hints:
How can you use the height function $h(t)$ to know the change of the
height between day $4$ and day $5$.
